section.title: Introduction
section.p:
There are a few approaches to integrate OpenEJB and Jakarta Tomcat. The difference between them is in the visibility of EJBs (deployed onto OpenEJB) amongst web applications (deployed onto Tomcat). The term visibility means what classloaders handle loading of the EJBs.
OpenEJB configuration by its visibility
OpenEJB per Tomcat instance - deployed EJBs are shared amongst all of the web apps
OpenEJB per webapp - deployed EJBs are visible only to the web apps that declared to load OpenEJB
OpenEJB Tomcat resource factory - an implementation of Tomcat's resource factory mechanism

section.title: OpenEJB per Tomcat instance
section.p:
Configure OpenEJB per Tomcat instance requires the following steps:
Copy the openejb-webadmin.war into the webapps dir of a running Tomcat install
Update the openejb.home init param (inside the WEB-INF/web.xml file) to point to where OpenEJB was installed
Restart Tomcat
Browse to http://localhost:8080/openejb-webadmin

section.title: OpenEJB per webapp
section.p:
Configure OpenEJB per webapp requires the following steps:
Copy the openejb-loader-*.jar into the WEB-INF/lib directory of the webapp that uses EJBs deployed onto OpenEJB
Add the openejb.home init param (inside the WEB-INF/web.xml file) to point to where OpenEJB was installed
Restart Tomcat
Browse to http://localhost:8080/openejb-webadmin

As with openejb.home environment variable that has been declared in the WEB-INF/web.xml file above, it's possible to configure others as well. It's as simple as add another <init-param> stanza to the deployment descriptor. At startup OpenEJB prints out all of the configuration settings to Tomcat logs:
section.code: INFO: Installing web application at context path /openejb from URL file:C:\webapps\openejb OpenEJB init-params: param-name: openejb.home, param-value: c:\openejb param-name: openejb.configuration, param-value: conf\openejb.cfg param-name: openejb.base, param-value: c:\webapps\openejb\WEB-INF\openejb param-name: openejb.loader, param-value: tomcat-webapp
